description.narrative: - Enhance the governance of the mineral and hydrocarbon resources sector. - Effectively regulate Afghanistan's minerals and hydrocarbons in a transparent manner. - Foster private sector development.

title.narrative: Geological Information - infield district studies and promotional events

target.value: 4 completed mineral district studies 5 sector promotions

actual.value: Site visits completed May-June 2012 for 25+ interested and qualified parties re: 4 copper / gold projects being tendered; Geo-DataAccess Procedures and Policies being developed; Investment Promotion Directorate actively promoting Afghanistan’s mineral andhydrocarbon investment potential through newly-developed newsletter (global distribution) and MoM presence at major internationalinvestment and technical conferences.

comment.narrative: The combined evaluation report for the second phase is finished. The new contract for second phase of the Geological SurveyCapacity building will resume by November 2012.

actual.value: Amu Darya Basin tender completed and contract signed late December 2011; limited production began summer 2012. Tender ofAfghan-Tajik Basin in progress.

title.narrative: Budget reflecting the priorities of developing regulatory capacity and mineral resources submitted to and approved by MoF

actual.value: There is well established interaction between the PMU and Task Team. Also the MoM is going to conduct donor coordination meetingsin which all relevant stakeholders will participate.

title.narrative: Strict adherence to the dispositions of the Minerals Law and Hydrocarbons Laws and associated regulations in the issuance of miningtitles, licenses, and contracts.

baseline.value: Baseline = No competitive (or otherwise) assignments of mineral licenses.

target.value: all licenses issued through the mining cadastre

actual.value: The manual cadastre is working. Will require some modifications and digitization once the Minerals Law is amended. However,capacity exists to manually issue all licenses through the cadastre

title.narrative: Transparency, competition, and fairness of mineral and hydrocarbon development agreements

baseline.value: Baseline = No process for transparent review of mineral contracts

target.value: International Advisory Panel operational and reviews major (>$20 mil) contracts. EITI adopted (validated)

actual.value: New IAP positions taken and IAP operational; EITI validation process initiated and well advanced. EITI implementation on track

baseline.value: Baseline = no major new investments in the sector.

actual.value: Completion of Hajigak negotiations has been delayed, pending approval of the new Minerals Law. Bid evaluations in progress for four(4) copper and gold projects offered for tender in December 2012. TAPI Pipeline global road show completed September 2012. AynakRailroad feasibility study underway.

title.narrative: Issuance of mining titles consistent with the Mining Law and Regulations

baseline.value: Exploration licenses - 0 Quarry authorizations - 0 Exploitation Licenses - 0 Hydrocarbon licensing rounds - 0

target.value: Exploration licenses - 37 Quarry authorizations - 210 Exploitation Licenses - 12 Hydrocarbon licensing rounds - 2

actual.value: Active Exploration licenses - 4Active Exploitation Licenses - 6Quarry authorizations - 224

title.narrative: Effective review of licensing (mineral development agreements) by the Ministry with advice from the International Advisory Council

target.value: 100% reports on all major (>$20 mil) transactions

actual.value: Aynak documents are finalized. The Hajigak contracts are drafted under close supervision of the IAP.

title.narrative: Two new medium-size mines under development by 2010

actual.value: Aynak feasibility study due to be completed by September 30, 2012.Status of Qara Zaghan gold mine unknown.Two oil blocks underdevelopment
